result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 089154,
Payable Number: 244781,
Receipt Number: 22R 012547,
Amount: $20.00

The original document was titled: Pretrial Assessment Report (sealed)
The original history event date is: 08-30-2022
Pretrial Assessment Report. Reviewed by SRN. SEALED w/ access to parties.  gll

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.

Not to use or possess firearms. Defendant to surrender any firearms in his possession to the St. Croix County Sheriff within 2 hour of release.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Vinny's Sports Bar and Grill in New Richmond, WI; N.W.B.; Z.G.O.; K.D.K.; W.C.O.; or C.J.S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:14 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Michael Becker appeared.  Jeremiah Harrelson appeared for Defendant for today. Defendant Richard Patrick Taylor in court, in custody. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. .  DE confirms address and DOB. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered. Court sets STC.  gll
